attributes.action: resign as a minimum apology for the government's failure to address the housing shortage which has resulted in unprecedented financial inequality between those who were fortunate enough to be on the property ladder before the boom and those who were not.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
House prices have tripled in 5 years in many areas. This has effectively resulted in a lottery win for half the population and life sentence of poverty for the other half.

This unprecedented financial inequality could have been prevented if the government had equalised supply and demand by authorising a sustainable house building program.

However, the government has failed to recognise the scale of the problem, and has failed in it's duty to ensure a fair and just society with equal opportunity for all.

I therefore believe the prime minister has no choice but to resign.

Please support this petition.
